Trace the payloads sent to the OPX via the Neve software
tshark -i en9 -f "host 192.168.9.21" -Y "tcp.len > 0" -T fields -e data > payload_log.txt

Example to send a payload (fish shell):

```
set -x payload 380b000014000000630200000001000000000014123c;
echo -n $payload | xxd -r -p | nc 192.168.9.21 51001;
```

Example Gain of Channel 2 from 20 to 70 (max)

Audio signal received:
380b000003000000684004


Working to change Ch3 to 40db
14 is possibly a write as 0e is the read value returned.
380b000014000000630200000001000000000014123c000000000000
